intro.title: Introduction
intro.text: Dreamcats ("we", "our", or "us") respects your privacy. This policy explains what information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding your data.

dataCollected.title: Information We Collect
dataCollected.text: We collect minimal information to provide and improve the game:
dataCollected.item1: Display name you choose when playing
dataCollected.item3: Basic usage analytics (pages visited, game sessions)
dataCollected.item4: Optional email if you create an account

cookies.title: Cookies and Local Storage
cookies.text: We use browser local storage to save your preferences (theme, language) and session information. This data stays on your device and is not transmitted to our servers.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.text: We use Vercel Analytics to understand how players use Dreamcats. This collects anonymized usage data and does not track individual users across websites.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.text: We use Convex for real-time game functionality. Your game data (room participation, moves, chat messages) is processed through their servers. See Convex's privacy policy for details.

security.title: Data Security
security.text: We implement reasonable security measures to protect your information. However, no internet transmission is 100% secure.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.text: You can request deletion of your account and associated data at any time by contacting us. You can also clear local storage through your browser settings.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text: For privacy questions or data requests, email us at

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.text: By accessing or playing Dreamcats, you agree to these Terms of Service. If you disagree with any part, please do not use the game.

description.title: Service Description
description.text: Dreamcats is a free multiplayer card game. We provide the game "as is" and may modify, suspend, or discontinue features at any time.

accounts.title: Accounts
accounts.text: You may play as a guest or create an account. You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and any activity under it.

conduct.title: User Conduct
conduct.text: When using Dreamcats, you agree not to:
conduct.item1: Harass, abuse, or harm other players
conduct.item2: Use offensive or inappropriate display names
conduct.item3: Attempt to cheat or exploit bugs
conduct.item4: Disrupt the game service or servers

ip.title: Intellectual Property
ip.text: Dreamcats and its content (artwork, code, design) are owned by us. You may not copy, modify, or distribute our content without permission.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: Dreamcats is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee the game will be available, error-free, or meet your expectations.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.text: We are not liable for any damages arising from your use of Dreamcats, including lost data, interrupted gameplay, or interactions with other players.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.text: We may update these terms at any time. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

contact.title: Contact
contact.text: For questions about these terms, contact us at

tutorial.welcomeDescription: First time? Let me show you how to play in under a minute.
tutorial.needsGameDescription: The tutorial points at in-game UI, so it needs an active game. Want to start a quick solo game now?
tutorial.goalDescription: Get the lowest total when the round ends. Cards are worth 0-9 points each. First player to 100 loses, so keep your score low!
tutorial.goalTip: 0 is best, 9 is worst. There are lots of 9s in the deck.
tutorial.handDescription: You have 4 face-down cards. You can't look at them freely, so you'll need to remember what you've seen!
tutorial.handTip: Memory is your biggest advantage in this game.
tutorial.firstPeekDescription: Before the round starts, tap any 2 cards to peek at them. Remember their values and positions!
tutorial.firstPeekTip: Tap 'Finish Peeking' when you're ready to start.
tutorial.deckDescription: Tap here to draw a mystery card. You can then swap it into your hand, discard it, or use its special power.
tutorial.deckTip: This is the flexible option - you're not forced to keep what you draw.
tutorial.discardDescription: You can see this card! Taking it is safe, but you MUST swap it with one of your cards - no backing out.
tutorial.discardTip: Great for grabbing low cards. Avoid taking high ones!
tutorial.drawingDescription: Each turn: pick a pile, then decide what to do with the card. Draw Pile = more options. Discard Pile = guaranteed swap.
tutorial.drawingTip: A known low card is often better than an unknown one.
tutorial.specialCardsDescription: Three cards have powers when drawn from the deck: Take 2 (pick the better of 2 cards), Peek 1 (look at any card), Swap 2 (trade any 2 cards blindly).
tutorial.specialCardsTip: Using a power discards the card. They're worth 5-7 points if kept.
tutorial.pobudkaDescription: Think you have the lowest score? Call POBUDKA! at the start of your turn to end the round immediately.
tutorial.pobudkaTip: If you're wrong, you get +5 penalty points. Be confident!
tutorial.scoringDescription: When the round ends, all cards flip over. Add up your 4 cards. Lowest score wins the round!
tutorial.scoringTip: Game ends when someone hits 100. Stay low to win!
tutorial.readyDescription: That's it! Low cards good, remember what you peek, call POBUDKA when confident. Good luck!
